duck: Agape (Christian rapper), Christian rap artist Dave Scherer
Agape Europe, the Western European branch of Campus Crusade for Christ
Agápē, a mixtape by American pop-R&B singer JoJo
Agapism, the belief that love should be the sole ultimate value, and that it is the sole moral imperative
Agape love, a term commonly used by Christians to describe God's love, defining it as unconditional love
Agape International Spiritual Center, a New Thought church in Culver City, California
Agape Church, a Christian non-denominational church in Little Rock, Arkansas

wiki.text:
'Agape' (<ref>[[Oxford English Dictionary]]</ref> or ; Classical Greek: , agápē;
Modern Greek: ) is one of the Koine Greek words translated into English as love,
one which became particularly appropriated in Christian theology as the love of
God or Christ for humankind. In the New Testament, it refers to the covenant
love of God for humans, as well as the human reciprocal love for God; the term
necessarily extends to the love of one’s fellow man.<ref>"agape." Encyclopædia
Britannica. Encyclopædia Britannica Online. Encyclopædia Britannica, 2011. Web.
17 Sep. 2011. <http://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/662884/agape>. </ref>
Many have thought that this word represents divine, unconditional, self-
sacrificing, active, volitional, and thoughtful love. . Although the word does
not have specific religious connotation, the word has been used by a variety of
contemporary and ancient sources, including biblical authors and Christian
authors. Greek philosophers at the time of Plato and other ancient authors have
used forms of the word to denote love of a spouse or family, or affection for a
particular activity, in contrast to philia (an affection that could denote
friendship, brotherhood or generally non-sexual affection) and eros, an
affection of a sexual nature. Thomas Jay Oord has defined agape as "an
intentional response to promote well-being when responding to that which has
generated ill-being."<ref>“ The love racket: Defining love and agape for the love-and-
science research program,” Zygon, vol. 40, no. 4 (December 2005), pp. 919-938
http://www.calvin.edu/~jks4/city/Oord~Defining%20Love.pdf</ref>
wiki.title: agape
